35232142: Flooding in Scotland's Dumfries and Galloway and the Borders region has caused significant damage, prompting calls for more preventative measures and faster flood protection plans.
40143035: Two tour buses parked at a hotel in Northern Ireland were set on fire, forcing guests to evacuate and causing damage to personal belongings.
35951548: Mercedes outpaced Ferrari in qualifying, with Hamilton taking pole and Vettel starting third; Vandoorne out-qualified Button on his F1 debut; controversial new qualifying system retained.
36266422: John Edward Bates, accused of 22 charges including indecency with a child, denies all allegations of sexual abuse made by four male complainants during his time as a scout leader.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at Cerahpasa hospital in Istanbul threatened to shoot himself and others, leading to an evacuation and police negotiation.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors defeated the Dragons with a last-minute try by Simone Favaro, showcasing their superior depth and experience.
20836172: Veronica Vanessa Chango-Alverez, 31, was killed in a hit-and-run in Streatham, London, and police are searching for the driver of the Audi A3 involved in the incident.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie died after a collision with a motorbike during a race, sparking concerns about safety and prompting an investigation by the sport's governing body.
40758845: Gundogan is recovering from injury and eager to return to the field, expressing optimism for the upcoming season and acknowledging Tottenham as a major threat.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to the hospital after a crash at the A127 junction, leading to a six-hour road closure for police investigation.
34615665: The first Category 5 hurricane to hit mainland Mexico since 1959 prompts questions about how storm categories are determined.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks discovered that many wireless mice are vulnerable to attacks due to unencrypted radio signals, allowing attackers to spoof signals and take control of target machines.
37922330: 38 staff at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell face redundancies as the company goes into administration, with hopes for some to find jobs at a nearby building firm.
30844962: The European Commission is investigating Luxembourg's tax arrangement with Amazon, suspecting it may constitute state aid and violate EU rules.
36217333: The Balmoral Show celebrates agricultural life with local produce, livestock showcases, and family fun, coinciding with Northern Ireland's Year of Food and Drink.
30816523: Max Mosley sues Google for not blocking photos of him at a sex party, arguing breaches of Data Protection Act and misuse of private information.
38900884: Eddie Jackson's injury is a big blow for the Dragons, but it presents an opportunity for other players to step up.
13890581: The Cornish Language Partnership receives three-year funding package to ensure language survival, but long-term support should come from Cornwall, not London.
40194700: Monaco's coach Jardim has chosen to stay with the club despite receiving offers from elsewhere, demonstrating the team's ambition.
37903647: The State Department criticized Nicaragua's election as flawed and not free, as President Ortega won with limited opposition and no international observers.
13291223: South African government forms task team to address "corrective rape" of lesbians after 170,000 activists demand action.
36052570: Big oil producing nations meet in Qatar to discuss production freeze, but skepticism remains; US stocks fall, energy sector hit by Citigroup's loan losses and Apple's weak iPhone sales.
34944735: Tarantulas' vibrant blue color is not driven by sexual selection, but evolved independently at least eight times, possibly serving as a visual signal or for camouflage.
32159602: Andreas Lubitz, the co-pilot of the crashed Germanwings flight, had made internet searches about suicide methods and cockpit door security before intentionally crashing the plane.
34988915: Former radio DJ Mr Fox denies multiple counts of indecent and sexual assault, claiming that his behavior was consensual and part of the workplace culture.
37889203: Dele Alli will be out for "a few weeks" due to a knee injury, according to Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino.
33609927: Jehovah's Witnesses' explicit policy of dealing with abuse in-house, requiring two witnesses to a crime, led to delayed justice for victims and reluctance to co-operate with authorities.
33578778: Yanis Varoufakis criticizes Greece's bailout program as a failure, while the German parliament approves negotiations for an €86bn bailout in exchange for austerity measures.
36888270: The IPC has opened proceedings against the National Paralympic Committee of Russia for widespread doping, with a decision on any ban expected in early August.
36846007: London Irish sign 24-year-old with Championship experience to bolster their squad for upcoming competitive campaign.
31723471: Manor Marussia F1 team secures investment from Stephen Fitzpatrick and appoints Justin King as interim chairman, aiming to be competitive in the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government agreed on a £39m stimulus package, but opposition parties criticized it as inadequate and not addressing the economic crisis.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister John Major warns of substantial costs and unpalatable consequences of Brexit, calling for more charm and less cheap rhetoric from the government.
20936833: The House of Commons is debating a bill to cap benefit rises at 1% for three years, with the coalition arguing it's necessary to reduce the deficit.
36832879: A collapsed sewer under the tracks in Forest Hill has caused major disruptions to train services, with repair work expected to last until Wednesday.
14958201: Mario Balotelli's goal and James Milner's late strike secured a 2-0 win for Manchester City against Everton, putting them at the top of the Premier League.
34352262: Nicola Sturgeon claimed to have met a target to reduce six-week patient discharge delays, but Labour accused her of misleading remarks and worsening delayed discharge statistics.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that the UK broke clean water laws by using overflow pipes at the Burry Inlet, leading to a case involving other breaches.
34303109: Pope Francis visits Cuba, praising improved US-Cuba relations and urging support for Cuban Catholics, while avoiding public criticism of the government's human rights record.
39939090: Rangi Chase joins Widnes after being dropped by Castleford, aiming to revive his career and help the struggling team.
29347771: Cricket Scotland's chief executive, Roddy Smith, is stepping down after 10 years, leaving the organization in good health and with growing participation and on-field success.
36783415: Sunderland wants Allardyce to stay, but England is considering him for the national team manager position, causing speculation and controversy.
37935687: Wales narrowly defeated Argentina in a close match, with Leigh Halfpenny's penalty proving to be the difference.
40260829: New Zealand's Bulford Kiwi and the Terrain Model of Messines have been granted protection as scheduled monuments by the Department for Culture, Media and Sport.
36478199: Two inmates at HMP Wayland attempted to grab keys from prison officers, resulting in their transfer to a higher security jail and additional time added to their sentences.
34541803: Former player defends Tim Sherwood's management of Aston Villa, citing his leadership qualities and ability to improve players, and urges the club to give him more time.
35360841: Transport Minister Edwina Hart aims to streamline the system and cut fraud in response to complaints about rejected cases and a rise in rejections.
35550407: Life expectancy among older age groups in England rose to its highest level in 2014, but there is concern about too many elderly people living in poor health.
37561590: Operation Equinox is investigating hundreds of reported crimes of abuse in Nottinghamshire children's homes, with 485 alleged offences committed by council staff.
39328843: The Women's FA Cup quarter-final draw has been announced, with Chelsea facing Sunderland, Manchester City playing Bristol City, and Liverpool hosting Notts County.
